docs.snippet: The news we receive from Mexico is of the highest interest. The formidable expedition of President MIRAMON against Vera Cruz had proved a failure. The main body of the reuctionists had advanced within nine miles of the city, when MIRAMON advanced on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The news we receive from Mexico is of the highest interest. The formidable expedition of President MIRAMON against Vera Cruz had proved a failure. The main body of the reuctionists had advanced within nine miles of the city, when MIRAMON advanced on the 18th ult., with 300 men to reconnoitre. The sight of the preparations for his reception seems to have discouraged him.

headline.main: THE SICKLES TRAGEDY.; Trial of Daniel E. Sickles for the Murder of Philip Barton Key. FIFTH DAY'S PROCEEDINGS. Close of the Testimony for the Prosecution. The Pistol and the Bloody Clothing Produced in Court. EXAMINIATION OF THE MEDICAL WITNESSES. Refusal of the Prosecution to Call Messrs. Butterworth, Wooldridge and R.J. Walker. Testimony of Coroner Woodward, Eugene Pendleton, Dr. Coolidge, Chas H. Wilder and Others.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Court was opened at 10:10 this morning. The pressure for admittance into the Court room was greater than on previous days, and in a few moments after the doors were opened, the space reserved for the audience was completely filled. Mr. Butterworth is in town but has not yet appeared in Court.

docs.snippet: The Formes' concert troupe has got into hot Water at Cincinnall. Formes publishes a card in the Gazette, giving his version of a recent difficulty with Satter, Anschutz and Thoras. He says: "Mr. Gastave Salter insulted, with gross and unmanly...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Formes' concert troupe has got into hot Water at Cincinnall. Formes publishes a card in the Gazette, giving his version of a recent difficulty with Satter, Anschutz and Thoras. He says: "Mr. Gastave Salter insulted, with gross and unmanly epithets, two ladies, who, in every relation in life, have borne an estimable, unblemished reputation.

headline.main: THE NEW CITY CHARTER.; Provisions of the Bill for Reorganizing the Executive Departments of the City Government.

docs.snippet: The bill submitting to the people the question of a loan of two and a half millions for tile payment of Canal debt, came up for a third reading. Mr. W. A. WHEELER moved to recommit, so as to increase the amount sufficiently to pay the interest on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bill submitting to the people the question of a loan of two and a half millions for tile payment of Canal debt, came up for a third reading. Mr. W. A. WHEELER moved to recommit, so as to increase the amount sufficiently to pay the interest on the Canal debt. Motion lost by 8 to 16.
